faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without significant restrictions. EU citizens have full purchasing rights. Non-EU citizens may need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number) and should consult with legal advisors regarding their specific nationality requirements. Most international buyers use Spanish property lawyers to facilitate transactions.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs including: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), property registration (0.1%), and legal fees (1-2%). Total closing costs typically range 8-13% of purchase price. Ongoing costs include property tax (approximately 0.4-1.1% annually) and community fees if applicable.
